alert.note: Alert for Montrose (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 30 at 2:26PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR HIGH FLOWS AND INCREASING RIVER LEVELS ALONG THE DOLORES RIVER DUE TO INCREASED RELEASES FROM MCPHEE RESERVOIR AND THE DOLORES AND SAN MIGUEL RIVERS DUE TO HEAVY RUNOFF FROM SNOWMELT. IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by increased releases from McPhee Reservoir and/or heavy runoff from snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Colorado and west central Colorado, including the following counties, Montezuma, Dolores, San Miguel, and Montrose. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas along the Dolores and San Miguel Rivers. Some low-lying river crosses and river side campgrounds may become inaccessible or inundated with water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 214 PM MDT, gage reports and forecast hydrographs indicate the Dolores River and San Miguel Rivers approaching or exceeding Action Stage due to heavy runoff from snowmelt. In addition, increased releases from McPhee Reservoir may exceed flood levels along the Dolores. River levels will continue to rise through the week. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Dolores River, La Sal Creek, Tabeguache Creek and San Miguel River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Naturita, Slick Rock, Bedrock and Uravan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to rising rivers, streams, or creeks as river levels often peak overnight. Please heed local advisories and closures.
